titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Maren Jakerlová, 1948, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Alyssa Mertka

did.abstract: The Jakerlová mss., 1948, consists of the manuscript of Poloplná mísa: román by author Maren Jakerlová.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Maren Jakerlová was a Czech author. Originally from Czechoslovakia, Jakerlová was exiled to Sweden during World War II. While in exile she became the co-editor of the periodical Listy ze Severy (Pages from the North) alongside Czechoslovakian art historian J.P. Hodin. The first issue was published in Stockholm in 1943, with the second issue following in 1944. The periodical included works in both Czech and Swedish from various Czech, Slovak, and Scandinavian writers, poets, and artists. Jakerlová is also known for her novel Poloplná mísa: román (The Half-Full Bowl), first published in Prague in 1948.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Jakerlová mss., 1948, consists of the manuscript of Poloplná mísa: román by Maren Jakerlová, author, accompanied by notes, a watercolor, and miscellaneous items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Jakerlová mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
